item.summary: NPE while creating new card from agile/planning

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi Grzegorz,

You have a data problem.
One of your assignees have no full name which is mandatory in JIRA.
I suggest that you open a support ticket at http://support.atlassian.com
They will be able to help you find the defect user and help you restore it.

Cheers,
JC
Thank you very much! It works now after I've updated some no-name users

Awesome, glad you worked it out!

Cheers,
JC

item.title: [JRA-40350] JIRA Agile Project Creation Stalled
item.description:
**Summary**

Creating an Agile project causes the project creation to be stalled.

**Steps to Reproduce**

  1. Create project (Agile Scrum or Agile Kanban)
  2. Enter the details of the project
  3. Observe the project creation is stalled

Error in logs

[common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: The project has been created but an exception occurred while configuring the project template. Please refer to the logs for more information.
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/current-@40000000542ebc932388b3dc com.atlassian.jira.projecttemplates.service.TemplateInstantiationFailure: The project has been created but an exception occurred while configuring the project template. Please refer to the logs for more information.
/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/current-@40000000542ebc93238b635c 	at com.atlassian.jira.projecttemplates.service.ProjectTemplateServiceImpl.applyProjectTemplate(ProjectTemplateServiceImpl.java:102)

/service/j2ee_jira/log/main/current-@40000000542ebc93238b829c 	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

**Current Workaround**

Create a board from inside JIRA Agile and create a new project in the process to be associated to the board.
item.summary: JIRA Agile Project Creation Stalled

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

item.title: [JRA-31647] System Error with com.atlassian.jira.security.type.CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission enabled
item.description:
Both the CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission and CurrentAssigneeHasAssignablePermission permissions should implement the getUsers() method.

Steps to reproduce

Uncomment the setting, after this, restart jira and configure your system to use it.

  • Enable com.atlassian.jira.security.type.CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission setting in /opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/permission-types.xml
  • Modify your schema permission:

Add to browse project : Reporter creator (after enabling the CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission, a new option appears)

  • Add Project Role (Developers) to Browse Project and Project Role (Users) to Create Issues in the default Permission Scheme.
  • You must have 2 users, 4 groups and 2 projects:
  • New groups: userA, userB, developerA, developerB
  • User A must be included in group userA, developerA, jira-user and jira-developer
  • User B must be included in group userB, developerB, jira-user and jira-developer
  • Project A developers group must be set to the new group developersA
  • Project A user group must be set to the new group userA
  • Project A must left unassigned the new issues
  • Project B developers group must be set to the new group developersB
  • Project B user group must be set to the new group userB
  • Project B must left unassigned the new issues
  • User A is user and developer in project A. He can explore and work project A.
  • User A cannot view issues in project B. He will see the project B. The CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission give him permission to open issues in project B and follow his issues, but only these
  • User B is user and developer in project B
  • User B cannot view issues in project A. He will see the project A. The CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission give him permission to open issues in project A and follow his issues, but only these

After you have that working, and have some issues, try to access the Gant Chart option and you will get the following error.

Feb 11, 2013 11:47:53 AM com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent filterFormParameters
WARNING: A servlet POST request, to the URI http://localhost:8525/rest/gadget/1.0/login, contains form parameters in the request body but the request body has been consumed by the servlet or a servlet filter accessing the request parameters. Only resource methods using @FormParam will work as expected. Resource methods consuming the request body by other means will not work as expected.

item.summary: System Error with com.atlassian.jira.security.type.CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission enabled

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment:
Hi,

I'm working with CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission enabled and would like to have this fixed as soon as possible. If you need beta-testing I'm willing to do it

Regards
Matt "Spuddy" Quail, Which set of users would you expect CurrentReporterHasCreatePermission.getUsers to return? The current reporter of the issue in question?
Is there any advances about this? I really need this. Thanks!

Hi Francisco Miguel Biete,

These sorts of issues aren't a high priority for us at the moment. If this is urgent, you should be add the following code to CurrentReporterHasCreatePermissions, compile that class, and patch your instance:

    @Override
    public java.util.Set<User> getUsers(com.atlassian.jira.permission.PermissionContext ctx, String argument)
    {
        java.util.Set result = new java.util.HashSet(2);
        Issue issue = ctx.getIssue();
        if (issue != null && issue.getReporter() != null
            && getPermissionManager().hasPermission(com.atlassian.jira.security.Permissions.CREATE_ISSUE, issue.getReporter()))
        {
            result.add(issue.getReporter());
        }
        return result;
    }

Instructions for building JIRA from source can be found at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Building+JIRA+from+Source (once you've built you can just replace the class in the jar).

It hasn't been tested and is not supported, but I hope it gets you some of the way there.

Regards,
Eric

Thank you very much Eric Dalgliesh!!!
With that code, I don't get an exception each time I try to access the gantt board. I will do some serious testing next week, but it seems fine.

I have compiled and deployed it in 5.2.7.

Could you include it in future releases?? It's not easy to compile Jira...
I have a fix for both PermissionTypes in an issue branch, will merge tomorrow morning to be able to watch the builds.

Thank you very much!

I you need help, I could test some kind of RC.
Fix pushed up to stable and master. Ready for QA.

item.title: [JRA-12059] Bulk Copy (clone+move) Issues to Multiple Projects
item.description:
Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015

Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap.

There is a workaround, though, that might be used for the specific use case defined in the description. It involves JIRA Importers Plugin (or JIM for short), which is available for both Cloud and Server deployments of JIRA. JIM allows for issues to be imported from CSV format (also available for regular JIRA users - not only Admins) and JIM's wizard includes a step where user select the project he/she wants the issues are to be imported into. So the workaround will be to export the desired issues into CSV file using Issue Navigator and then import them back into another project using JIM.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can learn more about our process here.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

Original request description:

I'm working on rolling out JIRA to a Big 10 University in the U.S. We anticipate the potential to have hundreds or possibly thousands of projects in our installation. One of the features we are keen on being able to offer our faculty is the ability to create a series of tasks organized into milestones (versions) such as phased assignments, research projects, etc. Ideally each instructor will be able to create task collections in a "master" course template, and clone out entire filter sets (including relevant issues and versions) to a collection of other projects belonging to their students. At the beginning of the course, the instructor could bulk copy these assignments and tasks out to each participant student's personal time management project, and they'd each have a unique copy of the tasks, organized into version milestones. Right now, I envision this will involve the following:

  1. The ability to create a project with tasks tied to given milestones. This functionality exists in the present version of JIRA (3.7.2)
  2. The ability to bulk copy (clone and move) an entire project milestone, including all relevant issues, to a list of projects. This feature does not presently exist.
  3. The possibility to deny the ability described in item 2 above to a specific list of users on the server.

I am willing to build this custom feature myself, but will need to purchase a source license first. However, the functionality might warrant a place in the default JIRA installation.

The advantage of being able to do this in a default installation of JIRA is that it would simplify multi-project installations for all Open Source communities.

EXAMPLE: all new projects need to perform basic project set-up chores (all administrivia you need to do to start an Open Source project, for example:

  • creating username on the appropriate servers,
  • setting up your ssh public keys,
  • mailing list tasks,
  • web site,
  • source repository publication,
  • adding developers and managing permissions,
  • producing unit tests,
  • documentation,
  • first release

All of these common tasks could be grouped into a "Getting Started" milestone that server admins could clone out to all new projects. We used to run into this problem at the CodeHaus all the time. The Apache software foundation also has a long list of things that all new projects must complete in order to become an official TLD. These tasks should be able to be auto-cloned wholesale to one or more existing projects from a master template.

I think having a case study on how to tie JIRA-based task management into the traditional academic enterprise would significantly increase the academic interest in this product. I saw some other issues out there that sort of batted this concept around, but nothing definitive or even that descriptive. I can't estimate how long this might take to implement, but welcome any suggestions or feedback from the JIRA development team.
item.summary: Bulk Copy (clone+move) Issues to Multiple Projects

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

comments.comment: The functionality I'm describing cannot be performed right now with a simple "move" or bulk move operation. It requires that we can copy and move multiple issues to ONE OR MORE projects at the same time, and control who has that ability through group management.

If the options menu for cloning included a comma-separated list of projects, this would be perfect. It seems, however, that we'd need to be able to limit who has access to that ability through some sort of group management for our enterprise.

Ideally, entire versions (milestones) would be able to transfer with the copied items, and allow the project lead to specify due dates appropriate to the version before the issues are copied to the other projects.
I'm surprised that Atlassian has not commented on this request. Is it because there's already a way to do this with JIRA? I'd like to know the status of this.
Hi we are doing requirements documentation . We need to do bulk clones to be able to duplicate and link requirements between projects.
We also would like to request Bulk COPY and Move of Issues.
We very much need the bulk copy of the issues ...its a major roadblock in using JIRA for Testcase Management

It is extremely crucial for us to be able to copy projects, components, versions, and issues.

We have installed the copy project which is ok, except that is does not copy issues. We have also installed a plugin to clone and move issues. It only allows bulk moving of sub-tasks (not bulk moving of parent issues), but relationships with components and versions for that sub-task are lost when moved.

Our setup is such that we need to create a new project for each show that we are working on. We do not want to recreate the versions and components each time. We want a standard set of issues that can be set up with each new show. How we can do this?

We also would like to request bulk clone and move of Issues.
Dear Atlassian,could you help us?

Ditto for us, we have a standard set of stories with project tasks, release tasks, sprint tasks, and monthly tasks that we need to do. We currently have to clone each parent at the beginning of a project, release, etc. We've combined these where applicable into a template, but this isn't ideal as developers spend more time deleting things (tasks) they don't need. It would be very handy to clone smaller stories in a bulk operation.

However from a UI standpoint I'm not sure how this would work, I would like to clone these (multiple parent items) X times and put each one in Y different places. Where X and Y are user defined? When all is said and done perhaps doing a clone on each one individually may be just as easy...

In any case, I"ll vote on this issue if someone smarter than me has good ideas. Perhaps just the ability to clone multiple parents would suffice.

This feature would also be very useful for SAP AG.

We have different jira projects to organize the whole development and we need to clone and move multiple issues/backlog items between jira projects. Nice thing would if we could put an optional link "duplicates" for each cloned issue pointing to the original one.

Regards,
Hristo

Would love a feature to bulk clone, as it's typical in my organization for projects to have similar build issues – for example, when we are basically repeating work from one locale (.com) to another (.co.uk) to another (.it) to another etc.

If using JIRA for SW-Testing you basically have a project used as testcase library and other projects for the testcase execution.
You start defining your testcases (all in the testcase library projct)... Later you copy the testcases into the other testcase execution projects.
In this scenario a bulk copy functionality would be very handy!

We have jusst launched a new plugin for this, compatible from 6.3.6
Check and evalutate on: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.lbcg.jira.plugin.pro.BulkClonePro
Best
Lars Broden

or your could try out our solution adressing this gap in Jira: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.lbcg.jira.plugin.pro.BulkClonePro

Lars Broden

Bulk clone/move tool is a must for Jira. It should allow changing certain fields while completing the operation. In our case we have to manually clone same stories for different components in one epic (could be 20 stories, multiplied for 3-4 components) which is madness.

Even more elegant solution for our case will be to have a Post Function in the workflow which checks against certain conditions, making necessary changes to some fields and the clones the issue. So for example you are adding one story in the backlog with 3 components, when it moves to "Selected for Development", the post action will check for these components and clone it 3 times for each component.

Actually the best thing will be to have some kind of simple coding language in the Post Functions section, so you could do whatever you'd like

item.title: [CONF-3054] Default page admin for new spaces
item.description:
I asked about customizing the default page on space creation.
Charles noted that it can be done, but by changing confluencd.cfg.xml.

Access to the filesystem can often be much more difficult than admin
web-access. So I'd prefer be able to set a "new space" template from the Admin Web
UI.

And since we tend to have a couple categories of spaces (ex. Team,
Project).. I'd like to have multiple default pages to select from when
creating the space.

Oh, and I'd like to have it all exposed via the API so I could automate
the process of space request/creation.

Nick M. noted some good reasons why storing in the filesystem would be less preferable:
> The problem with the filesystem approach is
> a) its often not easy to get access to the filesystem (firewalls, etc)
> b) you have to start giving out os/filesystem permissions on top of
> confluence permissioning - its extra overhead.
> c) its not transactional (not trivially, anyway)
> d) its a big barrier to clustering (having to share a
> filesystem is very
> expensive - as well as being quite limiting)
> e) the versioning isnt integrated, and also a pita (I assume
> you mean using
> cvs...)
> f) its a PITA when you have to move between staging and live
> (you have a
> filesystem dependancy in addition to the EAR)
>
> In short, in our environment, we are very small fans of using the
> filesystem for storing data (we leave that work to the database)
>
> -Nick
>

item.summary: Should show 'Permission error' when JIRA unable to start SSO because fail to read the file 'crowd.properties'

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Additionally, if crowd.properties doesn't exist, the same error occurs.

JIRA version 5.2.5.
True. Forgot to copy crowd.properties after WAR upgrade (6.1->6.2) and this issue was the only hint as to what could be wrong.
I've got same issue with Jira 6.2.7. I got the error when my 'crowd.properties' doesn't exists.

Thanks for taking the time to raise this issue.

Due to the large volume of JIRA feature suggestions, we have to prioritise our development efforts. In part, that means concentrating on those issues that resonate the most with our users.

I am writing this note to advise you, that we have decided to close your Suggestion as it has not gained traction on jira.atlassian.com. We believe being upfront and direct with you will assist you in your decision making rather than believing Atlassian will eventually address this issue.

Thank you again for your suggestion and if you have any concerns or question, please don’t hesitate to email me.
Kind Regards,
Kerrod Williams
JIRA Product Management
kerrod.williams at atlassian dot com

item.title: [JRA-44861] Closing an issue from the new Project Navigation view returns an error "401 Unauthorized"
item.description:
Hi there!

We are working to install a SSO solution at a customer's instance. Everything works fine, except when wanting to close an issue from the new Project Navigation view. Then it fails.

After analysing the problem in detail, we have detected that when closing an issue from this new view, JIRA is always returning a "401 Unauthorized" error (see Developer Tools section in the attached screenshots). All other actions (ie. resolve issue) return a "200 OK".

Steps to reproduce this behavior:
1. Install a standalone JIRA, version 6.4.7 or JIRA 6.4.10. Perhaps other versions are also affected.
2. Create a new project and populate it with some issues.
3. Switch Workflow of the project to Default.
4. Enable Development Tools in any browser (we used Chrome).
5. Go to the new Project Navigation view, select any issue and click on "Close"
6. Check the result of the Ajax call - the call should be similar to 

AjaxIssueEditAction!default.jspa?decorator=none&issueId=10002&_=1439969896285

7. This is only happening when executing the transition to "Closed". Going to other statuses of the workflow does not generate this error message. We could reproduce it in versions 6.4.7 and 6.4.10.

item.summary: Closing an issue from the new Project Navigation view returns an error "401 Unauthorized"

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment:
Some more information, we hope it can be useful:

If we remove the "jira.issue.editable" property from the Closed step in the workflow, this "401 Unauthorized" error is not appearing anymore.

Unfortunately, this is not something we can take as a workaround, since we don't want Closed issues to be edited.

Hi beecom AG,

The 401 response here is expected, this is happening because the client tries to retrieve the information to display the inline-edit fields and it gets a 401 because it is, in fact, not allowed to edit issues. The issue is closed without any problems before hand and displays in the GUI as such.

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández.
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].

Hi Oswaldo,

Thanks a lot for your reply. Apparently we haven't explained us well enough.

Using the Default JIRA Workflow, we are:

  • Closing an issue using the new Project Navigation view.
  • Getting an HTTP error 401 Unauthorized.

We don't understand Atlassian's changes of the JIRA implementation, calling some inline-edit operation in this context.
We just expect some core functionality such as closing an issue to work without any inappropriate error codes, as it used to be.

Best regards,
Marc Rodriguez
Beecom AG

Hi beecom AG,

The client application calls the server to check if the inline-edit operations are available. In the case they are not available (for example, the issue is in a non editable state), the server responds with a 401. That's not an error, is perfectly fine and is used to communicate the results back to the client application.

Best regards,
Sergio

Hi Sergio and Oswaldo,

it seems you don't get the point.

We are using standard JIRA, clicking on Close issue in the new Project Navigation view and get a 401.
The user has the permission to close the issue. No error should be returned.

So it seems that something in the background implementation of JIRA has changed, now calling this inline-edit, which then causes this wrong error code. The user does not want to edit the issue at all. Looks like there is something wrong in JIRA 6.4

Again:
We are using standard JIRA, clicking on Close issue in the new Project Navigation view and get a 401. No error should be returned in that case.

Please investigate again.
We would really appreciate it, if you could help us to really solve this problem.

Cheers,
Stefan

hi, we are detecting the very same issue too ... while this is normally not a problem, it makes certain browsers (e.g. Chrome) triggering a re-authentication / re-login when behind a proxy (because an intermediate request was sending back a 401...) - and this is actually a problem.

could you please re-evaluate this. you should not return a permission denied error, because an issue has status "Closed" - this is not a permission violation, but a violation trying to edit a closed issue, in case editing of closed issues is forbidden (which is the default in JIRA).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: 25% - affects a minority of users or feature is not regularly used

item.title: [GHS-11396] Creating the 'Agile Kanban' or 'Agile Scrum' project types require the active user have browse permission according to default permissions/role
item.description:
Steps to replicate:

  1. Alter the default permission scheme to remove all users/groups/roles from the 'Browse Project' permission
  2. Create a project of the type 'Agile Kanban' or 'Agile Scrum'

Expected Result:

Project is created and user is taken to project admin page.

Workaround:

  • https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/Exception+is+thrown+when+creating+projects+based+on+GreenHopper+templates
item.summary: Creating the 'Agile Kanban' or 'Agile Scrum' project types require the active user have browse permission according to default permissions/role

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

comments.comment: I can also confirm this is happening

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: 25% - affects a minority of users or feature is not regularly used

item.title: [GHS-11236] Error when trying to add issues to a sprint using bulk change
item.description:
1. Search for issues (project = <projectname> and reporter = current.user() and created > -2hours)
2. Select "bulk action"
3. Select all
4. Select edit
5. Check and edit "Change sprint" field

Expected:
Field is updated and issues are added to chose sprint.

Actual:
Step 3 of 4: Operation Details
Choose the bulk action(s) you wish to perform on the selected 14 issue(s).
An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. item.summary: after I created custom field , all field was duplicated

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment:
Jangil,

As this is a support query and we have an issue raised for it on support.atlassian.com I'll close the issue here.

Cheers,
David Currie
Atlassian Support

item.summary: Cannot resolve ticket. details as in description

comments.comment:
ratchada chatsangar, it appears that you were intending to get in touch with Atlassian Support. Please go to support.atlassian.com to open a support case, so that the engineers can investigate further and help you out.

If you wanted to report a JIRA Service Desk bug, could you please provide more details on the steps that led to the stack trace?

item.title: [JRA-30952] Creating issue link throws an exception for unexpected HTTP response
item.description:
Unable to create issue link from JAC to Ecosystem

System Error

A system error has occurred.

If this problem persists, please contact your JIRA administrators.

Otherwise, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

    a description of your problem
    cut & paste the error and system information found below 

Cause:
java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to parse remote JIRA response

Stack Trace: [hide]

java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to parse remote JIRA response

item.summary: Creating issue link throws an exception for unexpected HTTP response

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRA-32157] Profiling upon JIRA startup is not allowing user creation
item.description:
If we turn on profiling upon JIRA startup, we can't create an user through the UI. The following message will appear:

System Error

A system error has occurred.

Please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page
Otherwise, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:

    a description of your problem
    cut & paste the error and system information found below
    attach the application server log file ( /opt/Atlassian/atlassian-jira-5.2.8-standalone/home/log/atlassian-jira.log ) 

Cause:
java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException

item.summary: Profiling upon JIRA startup is not allowing user creation

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment: Mark Lassau [Atlassian], is this going to affect 6.0 when people try to diagnose user creation with the new "secret" rename user feature?

Rename user will not improve this or make it any better.

The "Profiler" creates a dynamic proxy that wraps production code and instruments it with timings.
For some reason it is barfing on OfBizUserDao.findByName() throwing a UserNotFoundException.

Caused by: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
	at $Proxy1605.findByName(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.AbstractInternalDirectory.findUserByName(AbstractInternalDirectory.java:117)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.UserNotFoundException: User <test> does not exist
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUserDao.findByName(OfBizUserDao.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.OfBizUserDao.findByName(OfBizUserDao.java:51)

I would suspect we have multiple jars or we compile against one and run against another, but IIRC OfBizUserDao.findByName() has always been declared to throw UserNotFoundException, so its a bit strange to throw Undeclared Throwable.
My first guess would be ClassLoader problems because of OSGi???

I think someone has to replicate this in the lab, then put it into debug mode.
Upon chatting to the JIRA Support guys here, we are rarely using the profiling option these days, so this might not be as big of a support issue as I initially expected. I'm happy to let this one go.

Chris,
What do you use then for measuring performance when you modify your Java, Software version. Or even when users are complaining about performance.?

Thanks,

Hi Tech,

My apologies, I was referring to 'we' as in the Support Team at Atlassian and how we troubleshoot customer issues. The ways we test when looking at Support cases does vary wildly depending on the specific issue, so I'd recommend just contacting us directly if you do think there might be a performance concern so we can help take a look and make some suggestions.

Regards,

Chris

item.title: [JRA-29679] Failure to create a remote issue link between JAC and EAN and vice versa
item.description:
System Error

A system error has occurred.

If this problem persists, please contact your JIRA administrators.

item.environment:
this happened with a number of issues, for example:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/STASH-2705
and
https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/UPM-2673
item.summary: Failure to create a remote issue link between JAC and EAN and vice versa

status.description: Issue is open and has not yet been accepted by Atlassian.

item.title: [JRA-30590] NullPointerException error when moving issue between projects with different custom fields
item.description:
When moving an Issue between two Projects that use different custom fields, user will encounter an error. This should be handled differently, with Jira allowing the user to either cleanse the data in fields that won't be used in the new project, or cancel the move.

Error message:

Oops - an error has occurred

System Error
A system error has occurred.
Please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page 
Otherwise, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:
a description of your problem
cut & paste the error and system information found below
Cause:

Workaround

The issues can be moved successfully if the destination Project/Issue Type is added to the context of the User Picker custom field associated to the source Project/Issue Type.
item.summary: NullPointerException error when moving issue between projects with different custom fields

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment:
Verified this exists with a clean 5.2 standalone instance:

  • Create 2 user picker customfields applying to different projects
  • Create an issue with a value set for one customfield
  • Move the issue to the other project

The result is the NPE shown above. Raised priority to critical since this is pretty much a show stopper for the move operation and quite a few customers seem affected.

Not sure if other custom field types are affected as well.

For planning the next update of our productive jira-installation, it would like helpful to know a approximate release-date of version 5.2.2.
Many thanks in advance!

Hi Marc,

The current planned date for 5.2.2 release is Tuesday 11 December, things may still go awry which means we may not hit this date precisely.

Cheers,
Eric
Same problem happens when moving issues between issue types with different issue type context.
This problem is still happening in version 5.2.2
Raiza Martins Dias - We have created a support request for this and you will receive an email with the details. Please respond with the requested details so that we can get this issue analysed.

item.title: [JRA-31152] Unable to transition issue via REST API
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

  • Start JIRA (reproduced in JIRA 5.1.0 and JIRA 5.2.3);
  • Create a test project (MTP);
  • Create a test issue (MTP-1);
  • Pick any transition ID (you can get it via http://baseURL/rest/api/2/issue/MTP-1/transitions); I will use the transition "5" to match with the documentation – but the error occurs for every available transition ID.
  • Following the REST API Documentation, POST the following content against the URL http://baseURL/rest/api/2/issue/MTP-1/transitions: 
    {
    "update": {
        "comment": [
            {
                "add": {
                    "body": "Bug has been fixed."
                }
            }
        ]
    },
    "fields": {
        "assignee": {
            "name": "jira admin"
        },
        "resolution": {
            "name": "Fixed"
        }
    },
    "transition": {
        "id": "5"
    }
}
  • It also happens using a reduced request, such as: 
    {
"update": {
"comment": [
{
"add": {
"body": "test comment :)",
"visibility":
{ "type": "role", "value": "Users" }
}
}
]
},
"transition":
{ "id": "4" }
}

Expected behavior:

  • The issue should be transitioned.

Current behavior:

  • JIRA replies an error 500:

item.summary: Unable to transition issue via REST API

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment: I'd be surprised if Bob Swift's JIRA CLI hadn't come across this issue. He has extensive tests. Could be worth seeing if the CLI works for you?

Hi Matt Doar (ServiceRocket),
We were able to transition an issue using JIRA CLI 2.3, but we suspect that it's using SOAP (or XML RPC) instead of REST. JIRA CLI work calling a java class, so we can't see the way it works. (Haven't tried using wireshark)
We found out this bug was happening on the tool that we used for reproducing the problem, not in the REST method itself. Follow up in case JRA-31315.

Authentication failed!
An error occurred while trying to obtain an access token. For application link "Ecosystem (61b6191d-d412-3043-a96c-75b7bceaed1f) http://ecosystem.atlassian.net com.atlassian.applinks.application.jira.JiraApplicationTypeImpl@13f7c22"

I am not able to link to real issue.

This is an existing VALID bug at this shouldn't stay closed as Invalid.

https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVBOX-21
Note: this bug is a JIRA bug and issue transition fails even if the Developer Toolbox plugin is disabled. Please reopen this bug.
Causes https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-154323

To reproduce the bug just create a Global Transition inside the Worflow, one that does not have a destination step (-1). This will trigger the bug and make anything releated to transitions to fail on REST.
I wonder whether the priority of this bug should be raised. Does anyone agree?

From what I can see in the original description of this issue, it seem like this is an error reported by JIRA when an invalid media-type is specified by the user/application making the http request to the endpoint:

From the error:

javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Error parsing media type ', application/xml'

In the case of DEVBOX-21: The toolbox plugin needs to be fixed so the request has a correct media-type.

The bug mentioned by Sorin Sbarnea regarding global transitions seem to be the one tracked at JRA-32132

Consequently, I am resolving this issue.

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández.
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: javax\.ws\.rs\.WebApplicationException: java\.lang\.IllegalArgumentException: Error parsing media type

item.title: [GHS-9746] View in issue navigator fails with Jira Agile 6.3.0.2
item.description:
The "View in Issue Navigator" all result in

"Scripted function "inSprint" compilation failure. Contact administrator. Message: Function failed to execute http method - failed with code: 404"

except for the Backlog "View in Issue Navigator" link, which results in a stacktrace:

Oops - an error has occurred

System Error
A system error has occurred.
Please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page

a description of your problem
cut & paste the error and system information found below
attach the application server log file ( /home/jira/jira_home/log/atlassian-jira.log )

item.summary: View in issue navigator fails with Jira Agile 6.3.0.2

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment:
Also seen here. The URL it attempts to open is: https://<hostname>:8443/issues/?jql=issueFunction%20in%20inSprint(%22My%20Product%22%2C%20%22Backlog%22)

Cheers,

Tim
This could be https://jamieechlin.atlassian.net/browse/GRV-316
Unable to reproduce this issue on latest version of JIRA Agile.

item.title: [JSD-498] Unble to access Issues / Filters
item.description:
We are using JIRA (v5.2#812-sha1:c4fbab6) and this issue happens intermittently.
The issues tab in JIRA gives an error resulting in me not able to access issues / filters.

Sometimes I am able to resolve the issue by:
1. logged off JIRA
2. cleared browser cache
3. logged off system
However, it is not resolving now.

This is the error in the catalina.out log (also attached):
2014-05-02 09:13:50,860 http-bio-8080-exec-77 ERROR Sankar.Ramakrishnan 553x3703670x3 1dnpp7y 10.176.19.143,127.0.0.1 /rest/api/1.0/menus/find_link [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service
java.lang.NullPointerException

Error on screen:
Oops - an error has occurred
System Error
A system error has occurred.
Please try submitting this problem via the Support Request Page
Otherwise, please create a support issue on our support system at http://support.atlassian.com with the following information:
1. a description of your problem
2. cut & paste the error and system information found below
3. attach the application server log file ( /data/jira-data/log/atlassian-jira.log )
Cause:

comments.comment:
Hi WP Service Account,

Could you create a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com? That way we can provide you with support specific to your circumstances and with higher security. The credentials should be the same as for this site (https://jira.atlassian.com).

Thanks!

Service Desk Team

item.title: [BSERV-4242] Stash shutdown is stalling
item.description:
Update 4-Dec: Stash shutdown is again stalling. Its taking stash.dev about 4 minutes to shut down with a series of log messages spaced out 10 seconds.

2013-12-03 19:45:56,862 INFO  [Timer-2]  c.a.s.internal.ssh.server.SshServer Stopping SSH server...
2013-12-03 19:45:56,862 INFO  [Timer-2]  c.a.s.internal.ssh.server.SshServer Stopped SSH server successfully.
2013-12-03 19:45:57,143 ERROR [Timer-2]  c.a.p.m.PrefixDelegatingModuleFactory Detected an error instantiating the module via Spring. This usually means that you haven't created a <component-import> for the interface you're trying to use. https://developer.atlassian.com/x/TAEr  for more details.

2013-12-03 19:50:27,866 ERROR [localhost-startStop-2]  o.s.o.e.i.u.c.RunnableTimedExecution Closing runnable for context NonValidatingOsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.stash.plugins.user-permission-debugger, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml) did not finish in 10000ms; consider taking a snapshot and then shutdown the VM in case the thread still hangs
2013-12-03 19:50:39,550 INFO  [localhost-startStop-2]  c.a.s.internal.home.HomeLockAcquirer Releasing lock on C:\Stash\Home
2013-12-03 19:50:39,581 INFO  [localhost-startStop-2]  c.a.s.i.server.BuildInfoLogger Stash 2.10.0-SNAPSHOT has shut down

Stash Deployment build failed twice on 18 March because Tomcat never shuts down. I have also had problems shutting down Stash when debugging on my local machine.

Bryan has seen something in Stash using a threadpool with non-daemon threads, which would cause a stall on shutdown.
item.summary: Stash shutdown is stalling

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Has this bug been fixed in 2.10.1
Ken Failbus Hi Ken. It is fixed in 2.10.1, are you still seeing the problem?

The status of the bug mentioned that it was open and that's what caused confusion. Please also can you look at the bugs mentioned as known issues for 2.10.x release. This bug was part of it.

In future please update the upgrade guide notes properly, this caused a confusion on software maintenance, Thx for updating the known issues list for 2.10.x release. For this reason, I had to abandon the scheduled software upgrade for stash from 2.9.4 to 2.10.x.

Ken, sorry that this has caused problems on your end. We usually are quite vigilant when it comes to closing the public issues related to a release but this one must haven fallen through the cracks. Apologies.

item.title: [CLOUD-5352] Activity Stream doesn't appear on the user profile page

In both cases, I think the underlying call is that this is trying to make a loopback request instead of what should be an internal gadget fetch. This is probably caused by use of an absolute URL instead of a relative one where the gadget spec URL is provided.

For some reason, this doesn't appear to affect administrators.

This could be a Studio bug, but I suspect it may be in JIRA itself.
item.summary: Activity Stream doesn't appear on the user profile page

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Raising to blocker because it seems to break the entire user profile on non-dev systems.

It's actually in AG. In the GadgetURlBuilder we have this :-

 "&url=" + encodeUriComponent(absoluteGadgetSpecUri(gadget).toASCIIString())

Examining this a bit deeper, there apparently seems to be a shindig requirement for absolute URIs

   /*
     * Shindig can't deal with relative URLs, so we need to resolve any gadget spec URIs against the server base URL.
     */
    private URI absoluteGadgetSpecUri(GadgetState gadget)
    {
        return resolveUriAgainstBase(applicationProperties.getBaseUrl(), gadget.getGadgetSpecUri());
    }

The real problem here is that the base url reports a different domain to the actual because of the jira-dev.com.internal trickery that takes place.

I'll have a word with Andreas to see how we can resolve this problem.

This is not a bug in JIRA - essentially the Gadgets will check if a local spec exists - if it does not then it will attempt to make an HTTP connection.

The problem is that if the local spec exists, and you fail the permissions check to view it, the gadget framework treats this hte same as not finding the spec and will then continue to issue a HTTP request. This is probably not a good idea ...

Offending code is in PublishedGadgetSpecStore

 private PluginGadgetSpec getIfAllowed(URI gadgetSpecUri)
    {
        PluginGadgetSpec gadgetSpec = store.get(urlBuilder.parseGadgetSpecUrl(gadgetSpecUri.toASCIIString()));
        if (gadgetSpec == null || !allowed(gadgetSpec))
        {
            return null;
        }
        return gadgetSpec;
    }

There has to be at least one project for which the user has browse permission to pass the allowed check...

Reducing priority on this because:

  1. It only affects non-admins
  2. Only if they don't have browse permission in at least one project

The long and short of it is that it is only likely to affect someone if they log in as a non-administrator before any projects are created, which seems like a fairly unlikely scenario.

I fixed the test to ensure there was always one project, but in hindsight this is probably a 'bad thing' - the data this test imports does actually contain a project, when it doesn't it is due to the index failure as seen in AOD-5624 . Me manually adding a project has masked this failure and means we're not logging the extra temporary instrumentation we added - I'm going to revert - this will probably cause some redness but may help us to track this tricky indexing bug down.
As Tim says - unlikely to be a problem in practice - also the test failures are due to a different root cause.
Reopening and removing the assignee. This should be moved to the bugfix backlog. It's an annoying bug, low priority, but I don't want to just ignore it forever.

item.title: [JRA-15881] Update German and French translations
item.description: Please see attached files.
item.summary: Update German and French translations

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: When looking into this, please ensure the attached translations address JRA-15705.
Also, please see if the translations address JRA-15729 and JRA-15745.

This is the updated version of the fr_FR and de_DE jar files with the paths placed back in the the suffix re-applied

The contents have not been changed

jra-15881.zip

Like Brad said in his comment above, the directory structure/suffix was changed which was a little bit of a pain to get everything back into same structure. It would be nice if the files are returned in the same structure that they're sent out in.

These are the issues found with the german translation:

  • MailingListCompiler_de_DE.properties:
    • template.subscription.filter.count = {0} Vorg\u00e4nge --> template.subscription.filter.count = {0} {0,choice,0#issues|1#issue|1<issues} ? Should be template.subscription.filter.count = {0} {0,choice,0#Vorg\u00e4nge|1#Vorgang|1<Vorg\u00e4nge}
  • admin_de_DE.properties:
    • portlet.admin.license.zero.user.limit = Es scheint ein Problem mit Ihrer aktuellen Lizenz zu geben. Legt eine Beschr\u00e4nkung von 0\u00a0Benutzern auf, die sich bei JIRA anmelden k\u00f6nnen. Best\u00e4tigen Sie, dass Sie den korrekten Lizenzschl\u00fcssel auf {0}My Account{1} haben. I don't think this is a very good translation. It doesn't link the explanation of the problem to the license very well. Perhaps something like this would be better: 'Es scheint ein Problem mit Ihrer aktuellen Lizenz zu geben. Die Lizenz hat eine Beschr\u00e4nkung von 0\u00a0Benutzern, die sich bei JIRA anmelden k\u00f6nnen. Bitte best\u00e4tigen Sie, dass Sie den korrekten Lizenzschl\u00fcssel auf {0}My Account{1} haben.'
  • ConfigurePortalPages_de_DE.properties
    • configureportalpages.title = Dashboards verwalten --> We seem to be using '\u00dcbersicht' everwhere else to say 'Dashboard'. Why not here? Plural? \u00dcbersichten?
  • ViewProfile_de_DE.properties:
    • preferences.default.share.public = Standardm\u00e4\u00dfig <b>ALL</b> k\u00f6nnen Benutzer freigegebene Filter und \u00dcbersichten anzeigen. --> Should be: preferences.default.share.public = Standardm\u00e4\u00dfig k\u00f6nnen <b>ALLE</b> Benutzer freigegebene Filter und \u00dcbersichten anzeigen.
    • preferences.default.share.private = Standardm\u00e4\u00dfig <b>NO</b> k\u00f6nnen andere Benutzer Ihre Filter und \u00dcbersichten anzeigen. --> Should be: preferences.default.share.private = Standardm\u00e4\u00dfig k\u00f6nnen <b>KEINE</b> anderen Benutzer Ihre Filter und \u00dcbersichten anzeigen.
  • JiraWebActionSupport_de_DE.properties:
    • issue.actions.and.operations.hide = Spalte ''Aktionen und Funktionen" entfernen. --> Double quote instead of ''.
    • webfragments.browse.project.operations.plugin.desc=Diese Bibliothek enth\u00e4lt die Webbestandteile f\u00fcr die Verkn\u00fcpfungen zu den Projektfunktionen auf der Seite "Projekt durchsuchen". --> Double quote instead of ''.
    • webfragments.preset.filters.plugin.desc=Diese Bibliothek enth\u00e4lt die Webbestandteile f\u00fcr vordefinierte Filter. Standardm\u00e4\u00dfig wird dies auf der "Projekt durchsuchen" Seite und den "Projektportlets" auf der \u00dcbersicht angezeigt --> Double quote instead of ''.
    • webfragments.view.project.operations.plugin.desc=Diese Bibliothek enth\u00e4lt die Webbestandteile f\u00fcr die Verkn\u00fcpfungen zu den Projektfunktionen auf der Seite "Projekt anzeigen". --> Double quote instead of ''.
    • admin.addproject.key.description=Das ist der eindeutige Projektschl\u00fcssel. Der Projektschl\u00fcssel: {0}* sollte kurz und aussagekr\u00e4ftig sein, da es jedem Vorgang im Projekt vorangestellt ist; {0}* sollte keine sensiblen Informationen enthalten, da diese eventuell von Benutzern gesehen werden, die nicht berechtigt sind, das Projekt anzuzeigen; {0}* kann nicht ge\u00e4ndert werden, nachdem das Projekt erstellt wurde. --> Missing \ in front of the * to denote a new line.
    • admin.globalpermissions.user.limit.warning=Sie haben die Anzahl Benutzer, die berechtigt sind, JIRA mit {0}Ihrer Lizenz{1} zu verwenden, \u00fcberschritten. Sie m\u00fcssen die Anzahl an Benutzern mit den globalen Berechtigungen "JIRA Benutzer", "JIRA Administratoren" oder "JIRA Systemadministratoren" reduzieren, bevor Sie weitere Vorg\u00e4nge in JIRA erstellen k\u00f6nnen. Wenn Sie weitere Benutzerkonten ben\u00f6tigen, sollten Sie eventuell eine volle Lizenz kaufen. --> Double quote instead of ''.
    • Lots more places where there's " instead of '. Not writing all of them down anymore
    • admin.externalimport.warn.user.limit.exceeded=Dieser Import erstellt {0} neue(n) Benutzer. Dadurch wird die Anzahl der Benutzer, die JIRA unter Ihrer Lizenz verwenden d\u00fcrfen, \u00fcberschritten. Neue Benutzer werden ohne die Berechtigung "JIRA Benutzer erstellt, und k\u00f6nnen sich deshalb nicht bei JIRA anmelden. --> Missing quote...which should be a single quote
    • admin.systeminfo.crowd.integration=Mengenintegration --> Should be (since Crowd is a product name): admin.systeminfo.crowd.integration=Crowd Integration
    • admin.errors.delete.step.draft=Ein vorhandener Schritts eines Arbeitsablaufentwurfs kann nicht gel\u00f6scht werden. --> Should be: admin.errors.delete.step.draft=Ein vorhandener Schritt eines Arbeitsablaufentwurfs kann nicht gel\u00f6scht werden.
    • admin.web.resources.plugin.jquery.name=jAbfrage --> Should be (since jQuery is a product name): admin.web.resources.plugin.jquery.name=jQuery
    • system.footer.personal.license=Eine {0}freie Bug-Verfolgung{1} f\u00fcr bis zu drei Benutzer? Probieren Sie die {0}JIRA Personal{1} Edition. --> Very literal translation. Probably better like this:system.footer.personal.license=Gratis {0}Software zur Bug-Verfolgung{1} f\u00fcr bis zu drei Benutzer? Probieren Sie die {0}JIRA Personal{1} Edition.
    • admin.task.taskadmin.refresh.warning=Hinweis: Diese Seite wird aller \0} Sekunden automatisch aktualisiert. --> Should be: admin.task.taskadmin.refresh.warning=Hinweis: Diese Seite wird alle {0} Sekunden automatisch aktualisiert.
    • All the default translations for issue types, resolutions, priorities, statuses were commented out and changed to english. Noone obviously read the comment at the top of that section!
What is preventing us to just migrate to one large flat file for each language? I believe that is the structure conf is using - at least then diff's could be easier?
Converting them as we speak . JIRA 4.0 will ship with just a single translations file!

These are issues found with the french translations:

  • General comments
    • In a lot of (very randmon) places '' where replaced with '. We put down some below. Generally these are really hard to find. It would be great if we can try to avoid this in the future.
  • MailingListCompiler_fr_FR.properties has a key not translated 
    template.subscription.filter.count = {0} {0,choice,0#issues|1#issue|1<issues}
  • JiraWebActionSupport_fr_FR.properties
    • All the default translations for issue types, resolutions, priorities, statuses were commented out and changed to english. Noone obviously read the comment at the top of that section!
    • Bad translation for 'Draft': Avant-projet should be brouillon
    • admin.web.resources.plugin.jquery.name=jQuery jQuery is a framework and shouldn't be translated
    • admin.addproject.key.description Is missing newlines. It's got a couple of bullet points which need to be on newlines
    • Shortcuts where changed. This will be very confusing for our users who have learnt certain shortcuts. Can these be changed back to what they were previously?: 
      alt.text.findissues = Rech<u>e</u>rcher des demandes
alt.text.findissues.accessKey = e
alt.text.createnewissue = <u>C</u>r\u00e9er une nouvelle demande
alt.text.createnewissue.accessKey = c
alt.text.admin = A<u>d</u>ministration
alt.text.admin.accessKey = d
alt.text.quicksearch = Recherc<u>h</u>e rapide
alt.text.quicksearch.accessKey = h
    • Here's a list of corrections. Some of these may be fairly minor (upper case vs lowercase, quotes missing...) but others are fairly major changes: 
      common.concepts.my = Mes
common.concepts.search = Recherche
common.sharing.exception.project.id.not.valid=L''autorisation du projet n''est pas valide : identifiant de projet ''{0}'' non valide.
common.sharing.exception.no.permission.project=Vous n''\u00eates pas autoris\u00e9(e) \u00e0 partager avec le projet : ''{0}''.
common.sharing.exception.no.permission.project.but.in.role=Vous ne pouvez pas partager avec un r\u00f4le dans le projet ''{0}'' car vous n''\u00eates pas autoris\u00e9(e) \u00e0 le parcourir.
common.sharing.exception.no.permission.role=Vous n''\u00eates pas autoris\u00e9(e) \u00e0 partager avec le projet : ''{0}'' r\u00f4le : ''{1}''.
common.words.draft=Brouillon
common.tasks.tasks.already.running.consider.impact=Il y a d\u00e9j\u00e0 des t\u00e2ches en cours d'ex\u00e9cution dans JIRA. Commencer une autre t\u00e2che va affecter les performances du syst\u00e8me.

item.title: [JRA-1160] User-Group-Project
item.description:
I am worried about the user management scheme. say i have 3 projects, 9 users, and three roles (pm,developer,user). and for each role and project i have one person assigned. Meaning Project A has one developer, one pm, and one user. And Project B has a different developer, pm, and user. This means i have to create 9 groups to effectively isolate and manage permissions. If the number of projects i create grows to 10, i now have 30 groups, 20users. 20 projs, 60 groups, 60users. This is growing quickly.

What if for each project i created series of roles ( developer, pm, user). These roles could be shared across projects. And for each project, i assigned users to a role. and with those roles i controlled permissions for the individual projects.

Now, continuing my example from above, in the case of 20 projects i have 3 roles, 60 users.

Iam interested in your opion on this.
item.summary: User-Group-Project

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Is this still a problem with JIRA 2.4.1 and later?

There is now the option of sharing permission schemes across projects. In the enterprise version, you can also assign permissions to the project lead, as well as single users, and reporters / assignees.

You can also add multiple permissions at once.

So - is this still an issue with 2.4.1?

Yes, it still a valid request.
With a role (developer, dba, user,...), and if permission/notification scheme are define with role UI, I could use the same permission/notification scheme for every projects. Instead of create for each project several groups : projectA_developer, projectA_leader,...

Suggestion : In my point of view it could be "simply" resolve by UI :

  • when edit group of a user, instead of select group in a very long list (in our case several screen/page), select project(s) and the role(s) of the user in the project(s). internaly is same as select groups = project(s) * role(s)
  • each project have internal permission/notification scheme (using group) and a external scheme (+/- a template) based on roles.
  • administrator create/edit scheme with role (custom and special like reporter, project leader...)

The role notion is a (visual) facility for administration.
Consolidating requests for role-based permissions in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2816

item.title: [JRA-10814] Clone Projects
item.description: Please add a feature that would allow JIRA to clone Projects.
item.summary: Clone Projects

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
What would cloning projects involve?

  • Cloning just the project info (obviously the key would need to change)
  • Cloning associated permission, notification, workflow schemes?
  • Cloning associated custom fields?

What are the problems that you're experiencing, that you think project cloning will solve?

Cheers,
Jeff

We're starting to do a lot of rails programming. We create a project with a stock set of components and versions. Having a feature that just put those things in place would be great.

The three issues you mention do make things more complex though, so I can see why this is a hard thing to deal with.

We have been using JIRA for a while now and have many projects setup and requests for new projects coming in regularly from the project / dev teams. It would be really nice to be able to copy an entire project and its components, versions, associated workflow etc. So projects could be created rapidly.

Hi,

It would be very valuable to me to be able to copy not only projects but components. It would save lots of time in manual keying in work.

We use JIRA for Change Request tracking with a very complex workflow. Since we are unable to prevent users from seeing select fields if they have the capability of browsing the project and its issues, I need the capability of cloning the entire project to another project in order to have a Public View project of all issues and their fields and an Internal View project of the same issues with sensitive proprietary attachments and comments.

I think it would be great because we set up Jira in a way that for our clients, which are always offsite, we set up the project and the we just use JIRA to submit WIP, Questions and get feedback for an asset - like a forum

Internally we would have to set up the same exact project layout for our internal artist as part of our pipline for a project.The difference here is that our internal use is much more involved , we track time, have a ton of screen-shots, feedback and revisions and comments - questions and answers that are only needed internal. The client does not need all that.

Now we could use One set up of the project for the client and internal if we were able to chose who is viewable on all attachments, issues and comments. So anything we feel is internal only .. would only be viewable by our internal team. That would be good too but still Clone project would be great, I could just set up the project Issues/task and subtask once/ Clone and rename to internal - How awesome is that!

In addition to the the June Comment, I had the need to create another project identical to my other project with just the name of the schemes changed, and the users were different. I had to make a few adjustments to the custom fields, but the need to recreate each part in a sequence that was not familiar to me (because I had only done it once before many months ago) was so burdensome. Then because of one thing I forgot to do, it caused me 5 days of doing it over and over again to try to get my fields up in the new project. I even had a ticket open to try to figure out what was wrong. I solved it myself yesterday when I realized what I forgot, but cloning that project and just renaming each of the schemes, key, project, etc would have been so much easier especially for those of us that don't create projects very often.

Dudes, this is really really sad that you cannot clone a project in Jira. We are wrapping up a project and moving on to a next-gen endeavor, we need to create a new project that has nearly 95% of the same components and users/groups, but apparently there is no way to simply create a clone of the project. There are 100+ components and 1000+ users/groups. Now we are stuck entering all these things in manually; it's an enormous time-sink for us, and prone to error. This can't be a feature that is terribly difficult to add, I added a "clone project" feature to Bugzilla in less than 3 hours, so come on, we shouldn't have to wait 2 years for something like this.

I agree with Scott! Come on JIRA give us clone project, please
Clone Project should be standard – I tried the work around method that was suggested by Jira support , that uses an unsupported plugin , and it failed to work.

We are in the process of evaluating JIRA. So far, it's been very promising, but I see this as the real stumbling block.

Our use of JIRA would be to track bugs and issues on a product we sell to various customers. The product or solution is in essence the same for everyone, and I had envisaged having a separate JIRA project for each customer installation. Now that I know we can link issues across projects, this would be a very efficient way of managing product bugs and issues which appear in every installation.

However, we would still need to set up each project individually, and we would like to have a kind of "template" we can apply so we can easily create the same components and versions across all projects.

I haven't researched workarounds, but would it not be possible to create the fields manually directly in the database? I don't like the idea of doing this as it looks scary to me, but I'm not a database expert (we are using SQL). I guess this could be done but would be unsupported?

So being able to rapidly clone "empty" projects would be the perfect solution and it looks like several people out there are requesting this feature.
We also DO REALLY need this feature. Please add it ass soon as possible.

So here are my IMHO thoughts inline on the questions Jeff poses above:

What would cloning projects involve?
Cloning projects allows users to utilize JIRA in a application lifecycle management sense in that they can determine what feature items can be associated with typical "project" that parallels their SDLC to some extent. Each release cycle can automattically generate a "basic project" or template with all the typical issues automatically populated with default values that can be customized based on what is going on in the next release. This would help us in terms of software release where the development is more like an assembly line such as in information systems related to clinical research orgs (CRO). Same basic software is released multiple times for multiple clients, some with customization some not.

  • Cloning just the project info (obviously the key would need to change)
    At the very least the project info and base level issues. Perhaps a "batched, clone and move" event could create a fresh project from an existing "template" project. Perhaps maybe something more elegant if needed.
  • Cloning associated permission, notification, workflow schemes?
    Make this configurable. Ideally perms, notification and workflow is abstracted somewhat from the project level objects so that projects could "subscribe" to perm, notification and workflow schemes already in existence, or possibly subscribe to new ones. The batch clone and move idea could potentially just grab what ever linkages exist in the template project if the user selects this level of cloning.
  • Cloning associated custom fields?
    Make this configurable. Ideally custom fields are portable enough to be repository material that can be drawn into a particular project. The batch "clone and move" idea could potentially just grab what ever is in the template project if the user selects this level of cloning.

What are the problems that you're experiencing, that you think project cloning will solve?

Some of us want to be able to create an SDLC that is more like an assembly line VS. product leveling, or extension. So, more like banging out cookie-cutter versions of the same system with minor configuration changes vs a whole new version of an exsting product.

JIRA would be awesome to manage this, but needs to be able to repeat projects with base configuration without having to "hand create" the basic beginning state (by adding issues etc...) of the assembly line prior to a starting a new cycle.

We have been using the http://blogs.onresolve.com/?p=57 plugin for JIRA 3.12.2 but it no longer works with 3.13.2.
Has anyone had any luck using Jelly for this?
The author of http://blogs.onresolve.com/?p=57 has fixed it to work with 3.13.x now, it works again for me.

Thanks Gum Shoes!!

I've just installed the 'Copy Project plugin' from http://blogs.onresolve.com/?p=57. It works like a gem.
Does exactlly what I was looking for - which is just basically to create a new Project based on a 'Project template'.

I created a new Project category = ' Project Templates'
Created new - Project templates - eg, External Client Project Template & Internal Client Project Template.
configured the standard schemes / security / workflows etc.
added a standard list of Components, Versions etc

Hi All,

We are currently tidying up our public JIRA instance so I will close this issue as we are tracking this request on the main linked issue: JRA-7020.

Cheers,
Roy

item.title: [JRA-25331] FIXED (SEE COMMENTS IN CASE SOMEONE ELSE HAS THIS ISSUE) Issues with upgrading in places from 4.3x to 4.4...if we cant get this fixed asap, we will need to roll back
item.description:

item.summary: FIXED (SEE COMMENTS IN CASE SOMEONE ELSE HAS THIS ISSUE) Issues with upgrading in places from 4.3x to 4.4...if we cant get this fixed asap, we will need to roll back

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

2011-08-09 20:16:22,598 main INFO      [atlassian.jira.scheduler.JiraSchedulerLauncher] JIRA Scheduler not started: Johnson events detected.
For whatever reason, the jira connection code was not able to deal with the long default DBO schema in sqlserver...if this is manually set in dbconfig.xml, everything is fine
In my case it was fixed by adding <schema-name>dbo</schema-name> to dbconfig.xml

item.title: [JRA-31758] Time since reports resulting in error
item.description:
When running a "Time since issues report" which should bring results, and choose for the "[CHART] Date of First Response" from the dropdown, an error surfaces. (as reported under support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-50962 tested project is "FIX")

When you pick a project which should not give results, you get the normal "There are no matching issues to report on."

Testing on emea-testing.atlassian.net confirmed this, below the stacktrace I got when reproducing this
item.summary: Time since reports resulting in error

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment:

Mick, this looks like a JIRA specific issue, so I've moved it into the JIRA project.
I run into this with JIRA 5.2.5 when selecting a custom field based on a custom field type of the JIRA Enhancer Plugin (the "JEP - First In Progress Date" type).

Same problem if you use the "LastViewed" field which came out in JIRA 5.2. If you select this LastViewed as the Date Field parameter on a "Time Since issues" report, it will throw a system error. This can be reproduced here on the jira.atlassian.com site in JIRA6.0, as wel.
We have this issue with custom fields created after a certain date (last week, in this case). Custom fields of type "date picker" that are very old do not cause this error.
This is on the branch specified.
When will this issue be fixed?

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Prerequisities for BTF:

  • jira charting plugin
  • Date of first response custom field on issue
    (this is pre-prepared on ondemand)

Steps for test:
Create an issue as userA.
Comment on issue as userB - this ensures set up of the first time response field.
Create report "Time since issues report" with "Date of first response" reports's date field configuration.

You should not see any errors but standard report image.

item.title: [JRA-36718] Anonymous Users can transition issues even though they cannot edit issues
item.description: As a user, I need to be able to grant anonymous users access to browse my project without giving them the ability to transition issues (and thus change the status).
item.summary: Anonymous Users can transition issues even though they cannot edit issues

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment: Our JIRA server does not allow anonymous users, but I've observed that users belonging only to "jira-users" (not developers) can resolve and close issues, although they are unable to edit. This happens with projects created with the "Simple Issue Tracking" or "Software Development" templates. "JIRA Classic" projects do not show this behavior, although all projects use the same Default Permission Scheme, which should allow only developers to transition issues. We are running JIRA v6.0.8.

Hi Nathan Given / Warren Jones,

Could you please create a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com? That way we can provide you with support specific to your circumstances and with higher security. The credentials should be the same as for this site (https://jira.atlassian.com).

Regards,

Oswaldo Hernández.
JIRA Bugmaster.
[Atlassian].

item.title: [CONF-30777] Separate permissions for managing Global Templates from Confluence Admin
item.description: Currently, the user must have Confluence Administrator permission in order to add and edit the global template. This could prove to be a major security risk if the company need to give administrator permission to a user which is employ to create and update their template rapidly.
item.summary: Separate permissions for managing Global Templates from Confluence Admin

status.description: This issue has been rolled out to our Cloud instances, and also fixed in a Server release. Please look at the Transitions tab to get to know when it was deployed to Cloud, and to the Fix Version field to find out when it was resolved in a Server release.

comments.comment:
As a Business Analyst, I'm responsible for documenting our project process, and updates to the corresponding project templates. We update these regularly, both with major and minor changes. It's impractical to expect a Confluence Admin to import changes from local templates to the global templates each time I make a change, as this creates a lot of unnecessary work.

Since the concept of Global Templates are not naturally tied to administering Confluence itself, it seems to make sense that the permissions around Global Templates aren't tied to the Confluence Admin.

Note that we use one space for each service / project, so simply having a local template is even less practical, as the local template would have to be copied across a large number of spaces.
This is really incorporated by CONF-7909.
Thank you. I've started watching CONF-7909. Happy for you to close this issue.

Anil
item.summary: Error in portfolio Page

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hello Anil Bhimineni,

thanks for contacting us. Could you please provide details on what error you got? Can you provide a stack trace of the exception or log files? In order to make it easier for us to reproduce and fix your problem, please also provide a plan export XML if possible (you can do this using Plan > Export in the top right corner of the screen, if you wish, you can also anonymise your data).

Thanks,
best regards,
Albert Kavelar | JIRA Portfolio Development
